resources.string:
its a time management tool. (and multitasking app) lets you track how you spend your time. the app can also track your break time easy to use for short term goals and long term short term because timers are easy to add and switch between tasks its flexible and even has a quick timer function for off the cuff alarms its mainly designed for long term goals because of the budgeting functionality long term because you can plan your time for the next two weeks. you list what you have to do then divide the time you have among those tasks. It was inspired by an article from waitbutwhy.com that highlights how limited our time is\n It allows you to switch between tasks freely and still be sure you are properly investing the amount of time that you have. made because i got bored doing one thing for too long by planning you can switch tasks whenever you want and be confident you are putting the correct amount of time into what you want to accomplish and not waste any time (it lets you accomplish multiple things and not waste any time) (so you plan what you want to accomplish in a day and switch between them when you get tired of one task. because we need to step away from something once in a while and refresh ourselves by switching to something else productive.) Switching like this allows you to have a flexible and reactive schedule as opposed to a rigid one. The app also shows you the overall amount of time that youve spent on a task as wel as how long since your last break and how long youve been on a break for
with this app you set the time for your goals first, then try to meet them

Get Started

 1. Add new tasks by clicking on the floating action button.
2. Specify a name and use the sliders to set how much time you need to spend on this task.\n
3. Then press the check button to create the task.\n
4. The name must be unique, if not, it will change the time of the existing task.\n
5. Click the play button on the corner of the screen to start tracking.\n

6. Use swipe gestures on the home screen to control the time tracker.
 	a. Swipe left or right to switch the task
 	b. Swipe down to track break time.
 	c. Swipe up on the break screen to stop break time.
7. You can also control the task from the notification icon.\n
8. You can delete tasks using the close button.\n

Actions

 - Switching tasks
 	Swipe left or right at the home screen.
- Taking a break\n \tSwipe down at the home screen.\n
- Resuming a task\n \tTo resume tracking a task after taking a break swipe down at the break time screen.\n
- Quick alarm\n \tYou can set an alarm that will run parallel to the main timer. The ringing bell icon indicates that an alarm is already set.\n
- Save and view lists\n \tSwipe up at the home screen. Then press the save button. You can cycle through the lists by swiping up or pressing the next button.\n
- Start or stop the timer\n \tStart or stop time tracking, stopping will also stop the quick alarm. If you only need an alarm its recommended that you create a new task to do so.\n
- Delete task\n \tClicking the close button at a task will do this. You can also do this at the budgeting page.\n
- Use a list\n \tUse the list that is currently displayed for tracking.\n
- New page\n \tCreates a new list but deletes the one currently in use.\n
- Adding time to task\n \tTo add or subtract time from a task you need to press the add task button, then overwrite the task with the new time that you want.\n

Swipe up to see lists of tasks. For each list you can allocate how much time you want to spend on those tasks at the bottom.
 You allocate how much time per day then how many days you want to spend. The max per day is 16 hours.
 Then you can ration out that time between the tasks in the list using the sliders. The time allocated to that task is on the left margin adjacent it. Sliders at the same position will have time divided equally.
 It shows how much break time is recommended for the time spent working in brackets. It recommends 10 minutes per work hour and will be tracked when switching to break.

To budget time:
 1. Swipe up from the home screen to budget your time.
 2. First we set the amount of hours per day that you want to set aside for work.
 3. You can then set how many days you want to monitor your time.
 4. Finaly you then divide the time you've set among the tasks in the list using the sliders.
